api_contracts.description: Returns a simple greeting message with HTTP 200 status code

component_logic.responsibility: Initializes and configures the FastAPI HTTP server with routing infrastructure

interfaces.description: Create and return configured FastAPI application instance
Register all route handlers with the FastAPI application

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI 0.104+ to create application instance. Configure with title='Hello World API' and version='1.0.0'. Set up routing infrastructure by calling configure_routes() during initialization. Use standard FastAPI patterns for route registration. No middleware or CORS configuration required for this minimal implementation.

component_logic.responsibility: Handles GET /hello requests and returns formatted greeting response

interfaces.description: Handle GET /hello request and return greeting message dictionary

component_logic.implementation_notes: Implement as FastAPI route handler using @app.get('/hello') decorator. Call ResponseFormatter.format_greeting() to generate response. Return dictionary with 'message' key containing 'Hello World' string. Handler should be synchronous (no async required). No request parameters or query strings needed.

component_logic.responsibility: Formats HTTP responses with proper status codes and serialization

interfaces.description: Format greeting response as dictionary with message key
Format error response with status code and error details

component_logic.implementation_notes: format_greeting() returns {'message': 'Hello World'} dictionary. format_error() returns {'status_code': int, 'error_code': str, 'message': str} dictionary. FastAPI automatically serializes dictionaries to JSON with 200 status code for successful responses. Error responses use FastAPI HTTPException with appropriate status codes (500 for internal errors). No custom serialization needed beyond dictionary structure.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify proper separation of concerns between routing, handling, and response formatting
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HTTPServerFramework creates app and configures routes. HelloRouteHandler handles requests. ResponseFormatter formats responses. No business logic mixed with HTTP handling.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify all error cases return proper HTTP status codes and error responses
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Internal server errors return 500 status code with error_code and message. ResponseFormatter.format_error() is used for all error responses. No unhandled exceptions propagate to client.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify endpoint responds with minimal latency and no unnecessary processing
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler is synchronous (no async overhead). No database queries or external API calls. Response is simple dictionary serialization.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify endpoint does not expose sensitive information or allow injection attacks
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: No user input accepted on /hello endpoint. No dynamic content in response. Response is static 'Hello World' message. No SQL queries or command execution.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response format matches API contract specification
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Response must be JSON object with 'message' key containing string 'Hello World'. Status code must be 200 for success. No additional fields in response.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify all semantic units from project plan have corresponding components
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: SU-001 maps to HTTPServerFramework. SU-002 maps to HelloRouteHandler. SU-003 maps to ResponseFormatter. All dependencies between components match project plan dependencies.

architecture_overview: Minimal three-tier architecture for a simple greeting endpoint. HTTPServerFramework initializes FastAPI application and configures routing infrastructure. HelloRouteHandler processes GET /hello requests by delegating response formatting to ResponseFormatter. ResponseFormatter generates properly formatted JSON responses with correct HTTP status codes. No database, caching, or external dependencies required. Single endpoint serves static greeting message.
assumptions: FastAPI is installed and available in the Python environment
Uvicorn or equivalent ASGI server will be used to run the application
No authentication or authorization required for /hello endpoint
Response should be plain JSON with no additional headers or metadata
Endpoint should always return 200 status code with 'Hello World' message for successful requests
No request validation or input parameters needed for this endpoint
Application runs on default FastAPI configuration (localhost:8000 or as configured by deployment)
